concise_definition: v. 欣赏, 感激, 了解, 评估

definitions.explanation_en: To recognize the value, quality, or significance of something or someone, often with a sense of gratitude or admiration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指认识到某人或某物的价值、品质或重要性，常带有感激或钦佩之情。
definitions.example_en: I really appreciate your help during this difficult time.
definitions.example_cn: 我非常感激你在这一困难时期对我的帮助。

definitions.explanation_en: To understand or fully grasp the meaning, implications, or complexity of something, especially after careful thought.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经过深思熟虑后，真正理解某事物的含义、影响或复杂性。
definitions.example_en: It took me years to appreciate the depth of her poetry.
definitions.example_cn: 我花了多年时间才真正理解她诗歌的深意。

definitions.explanation_en: To increase in value or worth over time, especially in financial or material terms.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指（尤指财务或物质方面）随时间推移而增值。
definitions.example_en: The value of this antique vase has appreciated significantly since I bought it.
definitions.example_cn: 这尊古董花瓶自购买以来价值已大幅上涨。

comparison.analysis: “Thank” (感谢) 是一种直接表达感激的礼貌行为，通常用于具体帮助或礼物之后，语气较直接、仪式化。而 “appreciate” 更强调内在的认同与情感共鸣，可以是深层的、非语言的，甚至不直接表达出来。
“Value” (重视) 强调对某事物重要性的判断和优先级排序，常用于理性决策语境，如 ‘I value honesty’。而 ‘appreciate’ 不仅包含认知上的重视，还融合了情感上的欣赏或感动，语义更丰富、更人性化。
“Recognize” (承认/识别) 侧重于确认某事物的存在、身份或事实，通常是客观的、中性的。而 ‘appreciate’ 在承认的基础上加入了主观的情感评价，如欣赏、感激或理解其深层意义，情感色彩更浓。
